TopicTitle: Wondering if there is a mod to do the following?

Articles.Content: I was wondering if there is a mod that allows you to say activate landing legs or shutdown engines and such without having to right click on the part. I just find it very difficult to right click on a landing leg while im flying.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's not clear what you're asking about. The G key (default, you can change it) deploys/retracts landing gear. No right-clicking needed for those. Engines are initially activated with the spacebar, but you would need to right-click to turn them on and off individually. 

Moved to the how-to section, but if it is specifically a mod you're seeking to do something else, we can move your thread to the add-on section instead.
You can also toggle engines using custom action groups. There's more information about those on [the wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Action_group).

You can always configure action groups to do what you want.

Default action groups are:

Space: next stage (duh)

G: toggle landing gears

B: activate brakes

U: toggle lights (not sure)

And probably a few others.

You can configure your own action groups, used with keys 1 to 9.

When in VAB/SPH go on the menu left of crew selection, select an action group, right click on a part and then configure what you want it to do.
